definition: -ly/structural particle: used before a verb or adjective, linking it to preceding modifying adverbial adjunct

sentences.english: A red carpet stretched across the cement floor, welcomingvisitors to a huge door that appeared to be forged of solid metal.
sentences.chinese: 水泥地上的红地毯一直延伸到一扇厚厚的金属大门前。

sentences.english: Seeing her on the red carpet was a sight I will not forget.
sentences.chinese: 看到她走红地毯的那一刻，我永远也不会忘记。

sentences.english: Women have better rest rooms. They get the nice chairs andred carpet。
sentences.chinese: 女人的卫生间很讲究，那里有精致的椅子和红地毯。

sentences.english: The couple eventually married, in November 1999.
sentences.chinese: 这对佳偶终于在1999年11月走上了红地毯。

sentences.english: Red carpets have become a primary marketing channel for fashion.
sentences.chinese: 红地毯已经成为时尚界最主要的一条营销渠道。

sentences.english: He walked alone down the red-carpeted hallway toward the White House residence.
sentences.chinese: 沿着铺着红地毯的走廊，他独自一人走向了白宫寓所。

sentences.english: They even rolled out the red carpet for us.
sentences.chinese: 他们甚至为我们铺上了红地毯。

sentences.english: Northwest. Turkoglu was given the red carpet treatment by the Blazers on Thursday.
sentences.chinese: 特科格鲁在星期二登上了波特兰的红地毯。

sentences.english: It is the starting point for state visits complete with red carpets and marching bands.
sentences.chinese: 作为国事访问的“序章”，它配有红地毯和军乐队。

sentences.english: Dubai is laying out a red carpet for the world’s companies.
sentences.chinese: 迪拜面对世界各国的公司铺出了红地毯。

sentences.english: As the Shuttles landed, guests would step onto a prepared red carpet and proceed straight to the celebration site.
sentences.chinese: 飞云梭降落后，宾客即踏著铺就的红地毯，直达会场。

sentences.english: Entertainment's live red carpet coverage of the 2006 Golden Globes ceremony.
sentences.chinese: 娱乐的生活，2006年金球奖典礼的红地毯覆盖面。

definition: ceremonial robe/formal attire (dinner suit, evening gown etc)
meeting place/place where people gather/CL:個|个[ge4]
a narrow street (lined with walls)/to line the street
to line the streets in welcome
gangway/ramp (to board a ship or plane)
